snippet: The South Korean military’s warning marked a sharp escalation in a war of words with North Korea and came amid consideration of new United Nations sanctions against Pyongyang.
abstract: South Korean military warns that it is prepared to strike North Korea's 'command leadership' if provoked, escalating war of words between two countries; comments follow threats from North Korea and consideration of new United Nations sanctions against North.

byline.contributor: Jane Perlez contributed reporting from Beijing, and Rick Gladstone contributed from New York.

lead_paragraph: The South Korean military’s warning marked a sharp escalation in a war of words with North Korea and came amid consideration of new United Nations sanctions against Pyongyang.

headline.seo: South Korea Pushes Back Against Threats From North
headline.main: South Korea Pushes Back on North’s Threats
headline.print_headline: South Korea Pushes Back on North’s Threats
